title: How to Make Scallop and Corn Gyoza

steps.headline: Discard small tough muscle from side of each scallop and in a food processor puree half scallops with sea salt.
steps.description: With motor running add tofu in a stream and blend until just combined. Be careful not to over blend.

steps.headline: Transfer scallop mousse to a small bowl.
steps.description: Chop fine remaining scallops and stir into mousse with white corn, red bell pepper, scallion, and coriander.

steps.headline: Put about 1 tablespoon filling in center of 1 wrapper and moisten edge of wrapper.
steps.description: Gather edge of wrapper up and around filling, pleating edge. Gently squeeze middle of gyoza to form a waist, keeping filling level with top of wrapper.

steps.headline: Make 17 more gyozas in same manner and arrange on a tray dusted lightly with cornstarch.
steps.description: Gyozas may be made up to this point 1 day ahead and chilled, covered with plastic wrap.

steps.headline: Heat oil in a large skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking and fry gyoza bottoms until golden, about 1 minute.
steps.description: Add water and steam gyozas, covered, 3 to 4 minutes, or until filling is springy to touch. Remove lid and cook the gyozas until liquid is evaporated and bottoms are crisped.

steps.headline: Serve gyozas with vinaigrette and garnish with coriander.

text: Discard small tough muscle from side of each scallop and in a food processor puree half scallops with sea salt. With motor running add tofu in a stream and blend until just combined. Be careful not to over blend. Transfer scallop mousse to a small bowl. Chop fine remaining scallops and stir into mousse with white corn, red bell pepper, scallion, and coriander. Put about 1 tablespoon filling in center of 1 wrapper and moisten edge of wrapper. Gather edge of wrapper up and around filling, pleating edge. Gently squeeze middle of gyoza to form a waist, keeping filling level with top of wrapper. Make 17 more gyozas in same manner and arrange on a tray dusted lightly with cornstarch. Gyozas may be made up to this point 1 day ahead and chilled, covered with plastic wrap. Heat oil in a large skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking and fry gyoza bottoms until golden, about 1 minute. Add water and steam gyozas, covered, 3 to 4 minutes, or until filling is springy to touch. Remove lid and cook the gyozas until liquid is evaporated and bottoms are crisped. Serve gyozas with vinaigrette and garnish with coriander.
